p: Loyola et al. (2001) isolated diterpenoids, namely 9,12-cyclomulin-13-ol or 13β-hydroxyazorellane,13α-hydroxyazorellane, azorellanol, mulinolic acid, and mulin-11,13-dien-20-oic acid from the aerial parts of Azorella yareta Hauman. All the compounds showed anti-trichomonal activity in vitro; however, it was very low, as observed from very high LC 50 values, 40 ± 120 μM, which is almost ten times higher than of metronidazole (LC 50 = 6.6 μM).
